properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A low pressure system from the US eastern seaboard could hit Southern Quebec with a mixed bag of precipitation Monday evening. Precipitation is expected to begin as freezing rain before changing to snow overnight or Tuesday morning. Freezing precipitation amounts could be significant over a few areas, making roads and other surfaces slippery. The exact track of this system remains uncertain, which may influence areas at risk. Further details will be provided in future forecasts. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-18T21:00:54-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-18T05:01:54-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3819368057.2019
Area: Portneuf area, Valcartier - Stoneham area, Québec area, Côte-de-Beaupré - L'Île d'Orléans area, Bellechasse area, Lévis area, Saint-Lambert area, Lotbinière area, Sorel - Yamaska area, Saint-Hyacinthe - Acton Vale area, Verchères - Beloeil area, Saint-Jean - Marieville area, Lacolle area, Bécancour - Villeroy area, Victoriaville area, Nicolet area, Drummondville area, Granby - Waterloo area, Brome-Missisquoi area, Richmond area, Weedon area, Thetford Mines area, Mont-Orford - Lake Memphrémagog area, Sherbrooke area, Coaticook area, Lac-Mégantic area, Cookshire area, Lac-Etchemin area, Sainte-Marie-de-Beauce area, Saint-Georges-de-Beauce area, Montmagny - Saint-Jean-Port-Joli area, Saint-Fabien - Saint-Pamphile area, Témiscouata

properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert - Traffic Hazard Alert For Hwy 16 West Of Wildwood
properties.Summary:
Description: Westbound traffic on Highway 16, west of Wildwood in Yellowhead County between Range Road 100 and Hwy 753, is being rerouted due to a motor vehicle incident. Vehicles travelling in this area need to be cautious of the highway closure and emergency responders on scene as well as traffic being rerouted due the incident. ### Go to www.511.alberta.ca for up to date Road Report information.
Expires: 2019-11-24T05:34:12-07:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Yellowhead County, 2019-11-17T05:32:04-07:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-6108
Area: Yellowhead County
properties.Author: Yellowhead County

properties.Title: Update: High Water Advisory Alert Is Being Issued For The Roseau River From Gardenton To Stuartburn
properties.Summary:
Description: Update: This is a Manitoba Emergency Alert. Manitoba Infrastructure's Hydrologic Forecast Centre has issued a High Water Advisory for the Roseau River from Gardenton to Stuartburn due to expected high flows. If you are in the affected area, be watchful of local waterways as flooding is likely to occur. Do not attempt to cross fast flowing waters or waters of unknown depth. Avoid flooded areas. Follow all directions by the local authorities. Listen for updates and take all necessary precautions to stay safe. Up-to-date information is available at www.gov.mb.ca/flooding and www.manitoba511.ca or stay tuned to local media.
Expires: 2019-11-18T16:30:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization, 2019-11-17T15:24:38-06:00, B165A632-E6E9-1120-A1E7-F9C4DCF391C4
Area: Roseau River from Gardenton to Stuartburn
properties.Author: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard easing overnight. Strong northerly winds with gusts to 60 km/h continue in Naujaat. Winds will gradually diminish overnight with blizzard conditions easing before morning. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-18T10:59:19-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-18T06:08:19-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0380678680.2019
Area: Naujaat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Les Suêtes Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Strong easterly winds gusting up to 100 km/h are expected to develop Monday evening and persist overnight. ### Les Suêtes wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-18T18:50:08-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-18T02:51:08-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1479890175.2019
Area: Inverness County - Mabou and north
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Strong westerly winds of 80 gusting to 100 km/h have developed over southwestern Alberta. These winds are expected to weaken overnight tonight. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-18T10:13:02-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-18T04:15:02-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1404608350.2019
